trans-unit.source: We recommend the following versioning best practices for the Azure storage services:
trans-unit.target: We recommend the following versioning best practices for the Azure storage services:

trans-unit.source: Explicitly specify the REST protocol version to use for every authenticated request.
trans-unit.target: Explicitly specify the REST protocol version to use for every authenticated request.

trans-unit.source: Set a default version for the Blob service using the <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Set a default version for the Blob service using the <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: The default version specifies the version to use for anonymous requests for which the version header cannot be set.
trans-unit.target: The default version specifies the version to use for anonymous requests for which the version header cannot be set.

trans-unit.source: Client software that uses a shared access signature (SAS) URL to access storage resources may experience unexpected behavior when the SAS URL specifies a storage service version that is newer than that used by the client software.
trans-unit.target: Client software that uses a shared access signature (SAS) URL to access storage resources may experience unexpected behavior when the SAS URL specifies a storage service version that is newer than that used by the client software.

trans-unit.source: We recommend the following to ensure clients work well with SAS tokens:
trans-unit.target: We recommend the following to ensure clients work well with SAS tokens:

trans-unit.source: For version 2014-02-14 and later, SAS token consumers using the REST API can override the REST protocol version to specify the appropriate version using the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: For version 2014-02-14 and later, SAS token consumers using the REST API can override the REST protocol version to specify the appropriate version using the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Services Version 2014-02-14</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Services Version 2014-02-14</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: For SAS token consumers using the Storage Client Library, the library ensures that the correct REST protocol version is requested.
trans-unit.target: For SAS token consumers using the Storage Client Library, the library ensures that the correct REST protocol version is requested.

trans-unit.source: For version 2013-08-15 and earlier, code that prepares and distributes shared access signature URLs (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS providers or generators) should specify versions that are understood by client software (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS consumers) that makes storage service requests.
trans-unit.target: For version 2013-08-15 and earlier, code that prepares and distributes shared access signature URLs (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS providers or generators) should specify versions that are understood by client software (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, SAS consumers) that makes storage service requests.

trans-unit.source: Always use the latest storage service version to benefit from optimizations included with each new version.
trans-unit.target: Always use the latest storage service version to benefit from optimizations included with each new version.

trans-unit.source: Some examples of such changes include:
trans-unit.target: Some examples of such changes include:

trans-unit.source: Version 2013-08-15 introduced the JSON payload format that reduces network bandwidth usage by up to 70% compared to OData’s AtomPub protocol.
trans-unit.target: Version 2013-08-15 introduced the JSON payload format that reduces network bandwidth usage by up to 70% compared to OData’s AtomPub protocol.

trans-unit.source: Version 2013-08-15 allows SAS providers and generators to add certain response headers like <parameterReference>cache-control</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-disposition</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>content-type</parameterReference> via SAS query parameters.
trans-unit.target: Version 2013-08-15 allows SAS providers and generators to add certain response headers like <parameterReference>cache-control</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>content-disposition</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>content-type</parameterReference> via SAS query parameters.

trans-unit.source: Version 2011-08-18 introduced the quoted <parameterReference>ETag</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Accept-Ranges</parameterReference> response headers required for optimized download and streaming via browsers.
trans-unit.target: Version 2011-08-18 introduced the quoted <parameterReference>ETag</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Accept-Ranges</parameterReference> response headers required for optimized download and streaming via browsers.
